org.jetel.data

Class FileRecordBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.FileRecordBuffer

  • public class FileRecordBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class implementing RecordBuffer backed by temporary file - i.e. unlimited size
    Implements FIFO: push & shift operations can be interleaved, however it deteriorates performance.
    Since:
    December 09, 2002

    • Constructor Summary

      • close

           throws java.io.IOException

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Description of Exception
        Since:

      • rewind

        public void rewind()
        Rewinds the buffer. Next shift operation returns first record stored.
        Since:
        September 19, 2002

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the buffer. Temp file (if it was created) remains unchanged size-wise

      • push

        public void push(CloverBuffer data)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Stores one data record into buffer.
        Parameters:
        data - ByteBuffer containing record's data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case of IO failure
        Since:
        September 17, 2002

      • shift

        public CloverBuffer shift(CloverBuffer data)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Returns next record from the buffer - FIFO order.
        Parameters:
        data - ByteBuffer into which store data
        Returns:
        ByteBuffer populated with record's data or NULL if no more record can be retrieved
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Description of Exception
        Since:
        September 17, 2002

      • shift

        Deprecated. use shift(CloverBuffer) instead
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • get

        public CloverBuffer get(CloverBuffer data)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reads next record from the buffer but leaves the record there - FIFO order. Subsequent calls to this method returns the same record.
        Parameters:
        data - ByteBuffer into which store data
        Returns:
        ByteBuffer populated with record's data or NULL if no more record can be retrieved
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Description of the Exception

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
